overview_summary: The neighboring landowners include a local family-run farm LLC, a private family trust, and an address-named holding LLC. The farm (Cedar Shade) suggests agricultural interests and community ties, the VanVechten trust reflects an individual’s estate-held land, and the Johnny Cake Lane LLC appears to be a speculative real estate investment. These entities’ motivations range from preserving farmland or family legacy to maximizing land value, which will shape their stance on development.

neighbors.name: Cedar Shade Farm LLC
neighbors.claims: Cedar Shade Farm, LLC is a New York limited liability company formed on April 26, 2016, with its principal address listed as 334 Kings Road, Coxsackie, NY [Coxsackie Business Directory](https://www.bizprofile.net/ny/coxsackie/4). It is described as a family-owned agricultural business in Coxsackie focused on cultivating crops and livestock using sustainable farming practices to serve the local community [MapQuest](https://www.mapquest.com/us/new-york/cedar-shade-farm-llc-427259558). The LLC’s members (owners) are not publicly disclosed in state filings, so the beneficial owner remains unknown [Coxsackie Business Directory](https://www.bizprofile.net/ny/coxsackie/4).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small family farm with local presence but no noted political or economic dominance

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the farm’s owners directly on-site; emphasize solar’s compatibility with sustainable agriculture (e.g., pollinator habitats, steady lease income) to address their farmland concerns and align with their community values

neighbors.name: William VanVechten III, Lifetime Rev Trust
neighbors.claims: The William VanVechten III Lifetime Revocable Trust is a private trust holding parcel 71.00-4-12, indicating that a local individual landowner (VanVechten) placed his property into a revocable estate trust rather than a business entity [Columbia University News](https://news.climate.columbia.edu/2019/08/22/renewable-energy-legal-defense-initiative/). As a personal trust, it has no corporate registration or public disclosures of officers or members, and its beneficial owner is effectively William VanVechten III himself (the trust’s grantor and presumably trustee) [Columbia University News](https://news.climate.columbia.edu/2019/08/22/renewable-energy-legal-defense-initiative/). There is no public record of this trust’s direct involvement in local development debates or organizations, so its stance on new projects remains unclear [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/business/article/Coxsackie-solar-law-draws-lawsuit-13791813.php).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime resident’s land held in trust; not known to hold any public office or lead community initiatives

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out discreetly to the trust’s decision-maker (likely Mr. VanVechten); acknowledge his family’s legacy and offer arrangements (e.g., conservation buffers or guaranteed income) that align with his estate planning goals to ease any concerns

neighbors.name: 259 Johnny Cake Lane LLC
neighbors.claims: 259 Johnny Cake Lane LLC is a limited liability company that acquired the residential property at 259 Johnny Cake Ln (an 840 sq. ft. house on a small lot) in Coxsackie for $127,500 on September 24, 2019 [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/259-Johnny-Cake-Ln-Coxsackie-NY-12051/30499043_zpid/). The same property had previously sold for only $31,044 (in April 2010), reflecting a significant increase in value by the time the LLC purchased it [RateMyAgent](https://www.ratemyagent.com/property/259-johnny-cake-lane-coxsackie-ny-12051-u7vpa). The LLC’s name (matching the property address) and lack of any other public business activity indicate it functions as a holding entity for that real estate, and its ownership is not publicly listed in any state filings (suggesting an absentee investor or speculative owner) [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/259-Johnny-Cake-Ln-Coxsackie-NY-12051/30499043_zpid/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee or profit-focused property holder with no local employment or civic role

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the LLC through its registered agent; gauge interest in selling the parcel or partnering, given their likely investment motive, and emphasize protecting property value to encourage cooperation
